summary_promot:
You are given an image and related metadata and context.

            Metadata:
            - Document Title: The Forest of Wolves
            - Section Title: Front Hills
            - Sub-Section Title: Yaoguai Chief Mini-Boss Fight - Bullguard

            Context:
            - Preceding Text: "# The Forest of Wolves

With both enemies dead, you should start to notice a trail of gold leading you down the main path toward a shrine in a small rocky ravine.

These Shrines are your checkpoints, and offering incense at them will allow you to rest up, refill your healing gourd, travel to other shrines, and much more (some enemies — but not all — will respawn as well). You’ll also meet the owner of the voice on the wind - the Keeper of Black Wind Mountain.

This friendly guy will be your guide and mentor for this part of the world, and will bid you to set out in search of Guanyin Temple, which burned down long ago but has since been rebuilt - but not by human hands. As the Keeper departs, he’ll bestow you with the Incense Trail Talisman, which can let you warp back to the last Shrine you rested at.

## Front Hills

He’ll give a lot more experience and Will when defeated, and you can also loot a **Purple Lingzhi** on the left. On the right you can spot green wisps that denote wandering yaoguai spirits, but trying to gather them will only cause the wisps to fly off, giving you a fraction of their Will.

Head back to the forest hill road, and this time make your way right to encounter your first mini-boss, a Yaoguai Chief.

### Yaoguai Chief Mini-Boss Fight - Bullguard

As your first real boss encounter, you should be prepared for big hits that can take a chunk out of your health, so it’s not a bad idea to make sure you’ve rested up and refilled your healing gourd before taking him on."
            - Following Text: "The Bullguard swings a mean halberd, which he can use to perform devastating overhand slams, and much quicker horizontal slashes that swing twice before a third overhead attack. Luckily, each of these combo hits usually end with him taking a long time to pull his weapon back out of the ground and reset his positioning, which is the perfect time to strike with a light combo or sneak in a heavy attack when he’s recovering."

            Your task:
            1. Generate a **short, clear, and informative English summary** of the image.
            2. Focus primarily on the **preceding and following text** to infer the image's **purpose, content, or narrative role**.
            3. Incorporate any relevant metadata (e.g., section or document titles) to improve coherence, **but do not assume any domain-specific knowledge** unless explicitly stated.
            4. Do **not** speculate beyond the visible content.



            Output Format:
            Preceding Text Summary:
            Provide a concise summary of the preceding text that gives context to the image.
            Image Summary:
            Provide a summary of the image, describing its purpose and content based on the context.
            Following Text Summary:
            Provide a concise summary of the following text that elaborates on the information related to the image.

Preceding Text Summary:  
The player is guided to a shrine in a rocky ravine, which serves as a checkpoint for resting, refilling resources, and fast travel. They meet the Keeper of Black Wind Mountain, who provides guidance and the Incense Trail Talisman for returning to shrines. The journey leads to the "Front Hills," where the player encounters wandering yaoguai spirits and prepares to face their first mini-boss, the Yaoguai Chief.

Image Summary:  
The image depicts an intense combat scene between the player character and the Yaoguai Chief mini-boss, known as the Bullguard. The Bullguard, a large, intimidating creature wielding a halberd, is mid-attack, emphasizing the danger and action of the encounter. The player's health and stamina bars are visible, indicating an active boss fight.

Following Text Summary:  
The Bullguard uses a halberd for powerful attacks, including overhand slams and quick horizontal slashes that lead into a third overhead strike. These attacks leave the Bullguard vulnerable during recovery, providing opportunities for the player to counterattack with light or heavy strikes.
